intro: Polymnia johnbeckii, commonly known as the John Beck's polymnia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, herbaceous stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Polymnia johnbeckii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
